Greetings everyone,

I am new to the forum here, at least as a contributor.=
..  I 
have "lurked" here for some time, and finally decided it was time I =

joined you all in your excellent discussions.  As a "tsuba man," I 
have e=
specially appreciated the recent activity on this site.  You 
are all so kn=
owledgeable and generous with your thoughts and 
comments---it certainly he=
lps someone like me who is relatively new 
to tsuba.  

I have very much en=
joyed the Kantei of recent days, and the 
excellent photographs of tekkotsu=
 that Jim has provided.  It really 
helps to have such images for reference=
.  

Fascinating thoughts, too, on the matter of aesthetic valuation of 
ts=
uba in pre-Edo times.  Jim's refereces to the tea ware of the day 
are intr=
iguing as well.  

Anyway, I just wanted to introduce myself and express my=
 
appreciation for the great activity on the board.  I will look 
forward t=
o seeing more, and to contributing a few words here and 
there.  Best to al=
l...

Steven
